intro: Andryala integrifolia subsp. cedretorum, commonly known as the Cedretum sandarac, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
